item.name: ELB::Backend Connection Error Rate
item.description: The number of connections that were not successfully established between the load balancer and the registered instances. Because the load balancer retries the connection when there are errors, this count can exceed the request rate. Note that this count also includes any connection errors related to health checks.

item.name: ELB::Average Healthy Host Count for the past 5 minutes
item.description: The number of healthy instances registered with your load balancer.

item.name: ELB::HTTP Backend 2xx Success Rate
item.description: The number of HTTP 2xx response codes generated by registered instances. This count does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.

item.name: ELB::HTTP Backend 3xx Success Rate
item.description: The number of HTTP 3xx response codes generated by registered instances. This count does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.

item.name: ELB::HTTP Backend 4XX Error Rate
item.description: The number of HTTP 4xx response codes generated by registered instances. This count does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.

item.name: ELB::HTTP Backend 5xx Error Rate
item.description: The number of HTTP 5xx response codes generated by registered instances. This count does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.

item.name: ELB::ELB 4XX Error Rate
item.description: The number of HTTP 4XX client error codes generated by the load balancer. Client errors are generated when a request is malformed or incomplete.

item.name: ELB::ELB 5xx Error Rate
item.description: The number of HTTP 5XX server error codes generated by the load balancer. This count does not include any response codes generated by the registered instances. The metric is reported if there are no healthy instances registered to the load balancer, or if the request rate exceeds the capacity of the instances (spillover) or the load balancer.

item.name: ELB::Average Latency for the past 5 minutes
item.description: The time elapsed, in seconds, after the request leaves the load balancer until the headers of the response are received.

item.name: ELB::HTTP Backend Request Rate
item.description: The number of requests completed or connections made during the specified interval (1 or 5 minutes).

item.name: ELB::Spillover Rate
item.description:
The total number of requests that were rejected because the surge queue is full.
[HTTP listener] The load balancer returns an HTTP 503 error code.
[TCP listener] The load balancer closes the connection.

item.name: ELB::Surge Queue Length
item.description: The total number of requests that are pending routing. The load balancer queues a request if it is unable to establish a connection with a healthy instance in order to route the request. The maximum size of the queue is 1,024. Additional requests are rejected when the queue is full.

item.name: ELB::Average UnHealthy Host Count for the past 5 minutes
item.description: The number of unhealthy instances registered with your load balancer.

resource.name: AWS ELB Backend Response Codes (dual axis)
AWS ELB Hosts Health Status over 5 mins

trigger.name: ELB::Average Latency >= 5s (LV={ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: ELB Average Latency is greater than 5s for last 5 min.

trigger.name: ELB::Surge Queue is full
trigger.description: ELB queue has more than 1000 requests/is full.

graph.name: AWS ELB Backend Response Codes (dual axis)
AWS ELB Hosts Health Status over 5 mins
